title-group.article-title: Bareapa und Johns Alptraum. Zur Vielschichtigkeit ethnologischen Verstehens im Zusammenhang einer Interpretation von Akkulturationsprozessen bei den Chachilla-Indianern Nordwest-Ecuadors

abstract.p: The intention of the article is to demonstrate the dialectical relation of self-understanding and understanding of the Other within ethnological interpretation. Proceeding from the conflict between the estimation of the reality of the Chachilla-Indians (formerly called Cayapa) on the part of a protestant missionary and the ethnologist, the whole ethnological enterprise turns out not to aim at "structures," "actions," or other "objects" but at the multiple forms of understanding with which it is confronted and of which itself is a part. Because of this hermeneutical orientation ethnological knowledge necessarily remains open for corrections and reinterpretations.
